feature.goal: Build a workout tracking system where users can log exercises, track calories burned, set fitness goals, and view progress charts with weekly and monthly summaries.
feature.users: Fitness enthusiasts and people trying to maintain a healthy lifestyle who want to track their workout progress
feature.constraints: Must work offline and sync when online, battery-efficient GPS tracking, integrate with Apple Health and Google Fit

userStories.title: Log Exercises with Details
userStories.description: As a fitness enthusiast, I want to log my exercises with details like type, duration, sets, reps, and weight, so that I can accurately track my workout performance and progress.
acceptanceCriteria: User can select from a predefined list of exercises or add custom ones.
User can input duration, sets, reps, and weight for each exercise.
Logged exercises are saved and visible in a workout history.

userStories.title: Track Calories Burned Automatically
userStories.description: As a health-conscious individual, I want the system to automatically calculate and display calories burned based on my logged exercises and personal profile, so that I can monitor my energy expenditure.
acceptanceCriteria: System calculates calories burned based on exercise type, duration, and user's weight/age.
Calories burned are displayed prominently in workout summaries.
User can view a daily total of calories burned.

userStories.title: Set and Monitor Fitness Goals
userStories.description: As a user committed to a healthy lifestyle, I want to set personalized fitness goals (e.g., weekly workout frequency, calorie burn target), so that I have clear objectives to strive for and stay motivated.
acceptanceCriteria: User can set goals for workout frequency, duration, or calorie burn.
System displays current progress towards set goals.
User receives notifications or visual cues when a goal is achieved or missed.

userStories.title: View Progress Charts and Summaries
userStories.description: As a user tracking my fitness journey, I want to view interactive charts and summaries of my progress (weekly and monthly), so that I can visualize my achievements and identify trends.
acceptanceCriteria: User can view weekly and monthly summaries of logged workouts, calories burned, and goal progress.
Interactive charts display trends over time for key metrics.
User can filter charts by exercise type or time period.

userStories.title: Offline Workout Logging and Online Sync
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to be able to log my workouts even when I don't have an internet connection, and have my data sync automatically when I'm back online, so that my progress is always up-to-date without interruption.
acceptanceCriteria: User can log exercises and view existing data without an internet connection.
All offline-logged data is automatically synced to the cloud when an internet connection is restored.
No data loss or duplication occurs during the sync process.

engineeringTasks.title: Implement Exercise Logging UI and Logic
engineeringTasks.description: Develop the mobile UI for users to log exercises, including input fields for type, duration, sets, reps, and weight. Implement local data storage for offline capability.
acceptanceCriteria: Exercise logging screen is fully functional.
Data is validated before local storage.
Basic CRUD operations for exercises are supported locally.

engineeringTasks.title: Develop Progress Chart Visualization Components
engineeringTasks.description: Create reusable UI components for displaying weekly and monthly progress charts (e.g., line graphs, bar charts) for metrics like calories burned, workout duration, and frequency.
acceptanceCriteria: Charts accurately reflect user data.
Charts are interactive and allow for time-period selection.
Performance of chart rendering is smooth.

engineeringTasks.title: Design and Implement Offline-First Data Sync Logic
engineeringTasks.description: Develop the client-side and server-side logic for robust offline data storage, conflict resolution, and automatic synchronization when the device comes online.
acceptanceCriteria: Offline data is persisted correctly.
Data syncs automatically and reliably upon network availability.
Conflict resolution strategy is implemented and tested.

engineeringTasks.title: Build API Endpoints for Exercise and Goal Management
engineeringTasks.description: Create RESTful API endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting user exercises, fitness goals, and retrieving aggregated progress data.
acceptanceCriteria: All required API endpoints are functional and documented.
API responses are consistent and performant.
Authentication and authorization are correctly implemented for all endpoints.

engineeringTasks.title: Integrate with Apple HealthKit and Google Fit
engineeringTasks.description: Implement the necessary code to read and write workout data and calorie information to Apple HealthKit and Google Fit, respecting user permissions.
acceptanceCriteria: User can grant/revoke permissions for HealthKit/Google Fit integration.
Workout data is successfully exported to external health platforms.
Calorie data is successfully imported/exported to external health platforms.

engineeringTasks.title: Develop Battery-Efficient GPS Tracking Module
engineeringTasks.description: Implement a GPS tracking module for outdoor workouts, focusing on minimizing battery consumption through optimized sampling rates and background processing.
acceptanceCriteria: GPS tracking accurately records workout routes and distances.
Battery consumption during GPS tracking is within acceptable limits.
User can start/stop GPS tracking from the app.

engineeringTasks.title: Implement Calorie Calculation Service
engineeringTasks.description: Develop a backend service or module to accurately calculate calories burned based on exercise type, duration, intensity, and user's personal metrics (weight, age, gender).
acceptanceCriteria: Calorie calculation logic is scientifically sound and configurable.
Service integrates with exercise logging to provide real-time calorie estimates.
Calculations are consistent across different user profiles.

engineeringTasks.title: Conduct End-to-End Offline Sync and Data Integrity Testing
engineeringTasks.description: Perform comprehensive testing of the offline data entry and online synchronization process, including edge cases like network fluctuations, app crashes during sync, and concurrent updates.
acceptanceCriteria: No data loss or corruption observed during offline-to-online transitions.
Conflict resolution mechanisms function as designed.
All user data remains consistent across devices and the cloud.

engineeringTasks.title: Set Up Mobile CI/CD Pipeline
engineeringTasks.description: Configure a Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment pipeline for the mobile application, including automated builds, testing, and deployment to internal testing tracks.
acceptanceCriteria: Automated builds are triggered on code commits.
Unit and integration tests run automatically.
Successful builds are deployed to a designated testing environment.

risks.title: High Battery Consumption from GPS Tracking
risks.description: Continuous or frequent GPS usage for workout tracking might lead to excessive battery drain on user devices, impacting user experience and app retention.
risks.mitigation: Implement optimized GPS tracking algorithms (e.g., adaptive sampling rates, geofencing for start/stop), utilize device-specific power-saving modes, and provide user controls for GPS frequency and accuracy settings.

risks.title: Data Synchronization Conflicts and Loss
risks.description: When users log data offline and then come online, there's a risk of data conflicts or incomplete synchronization, potentially leading to data loss or inconsistencies if not handled robustly.
risks.mitigation: Implement robust conflict resolution strategies (e.g., last-write-wins with timestamp, user-prompted resolution for critical conflicts), conduct thorough testing of all sync scenarios, and provide clear error handling and recovery options for sync failures.

risks.title: Complexity and Maintenance of Health Kit / Google Fit Integrations
risks.description: Integrating with platform-specific health APIs (Apple HealthKit, Google Fit) can be complex due to varying data models, strict permissions, and potential API changes, leading to delays or ongoing maintenance burden.
risks.mitigation: Allocate dedicated engineering resources with prior experience in these platforms, thoroughly review API documentation and best practices, and build modular integration layers to isolate platform-specific logic and simplify future updates.

risks.title: Inaccurate Calorie Burn Calculations
risks.description: The accuracy of calorie burn calculations can vary significantly based on the formulas used and the completeness of user profile data, potentially leading to user dissatisfaction or distrust in the system.
risks.mitigation: Utilize scientifically validated calorie calculation formulas, allow users to input detailed personal metrics, provide transparency on how calories are calculated, and offer options for manual adjustment or integration with external heart rate monitors for better accuracy.

feature.goal: Build a task management system where users can create, organize, and track their daily tasks with categories and due dates.
feature.users: Busy professionals and students who need to stay organized and productive
feature.constraints: Must work offline, sync across devices, mobile-friendly interface

userStories.title: Create and Manage Tasks
userStories.description: As a busy professional, I want to quickly create, edit, and delete tasks with a title, description, and due date, so that I can capture and manage all my to-dos efficiently.
acceptanceCriteria: User can add a new task with title, description, and due date.
User can edit an existing task's details.
User can mark a task as complete.
User can delete a task.

userStories.title: Organize Tasks with Categories
userStories.description: As a student, I want to assign tasks to custom categories (e.g., 'Homework', 'Projects', 'Personal') and filter tasks by category, so that I can easily group and find related tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: User can create custom categories.
User can assign a task to one or more categories.
User can filter the task list by category.
User can view all tasks belonging to a specific category.

userStories.title: Offline Access and Cross-Device Sync
userStories.description: As a user on the go, I want to access and update my tasks even without an internet connection, and have them sync automatically across all my devices when I'm back online, so that my productivity isn't interrupted by connectivity issues.
acceptanceCriteria: User can create and modify tasks while offline.
All offline changes are synchronized to the cloud when an internet connection is restored.
Tasks are consistent across all logged-in devices after synchronization.
User is notified of any synchronization conflicts (if applicable).

userStories.title: Mobile-Friendly Task View
userStories.description: As a busy professional, I want to view and interact with my tasks on my smartphone with an intuitive and responsive interface, so that I can manage my tasks effectively from anywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: The application layout adapts correctly to different mobile screen sizes.
All task management functionalities are easily accessible and usable on mobile devices.
Touch gestures (e.g., swipe to complete) are supported for common actions.

engineeringTasks.title: Design Database Schema for Tasks & Categories
engineeringTasks.description: Define the database tables, relationships, and fields for tasks, categories, and user accounts.
acceptanceCriteria: ERD (Entity-Relationship Diagram) is approved.
Schema supports task attributes (title, description, due date, status, category IDs).
Schema supports user accounts and their associated tasks/categories.

engineeringTasks.title: Develop Task CRUD API Endpoints
engineeringTasks.description: Implement RESTful API endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting tasks, including filtering by category and due date.
acceptanceCriteria: API endpoints for POST /tasks, GET /tasks, GET /tasks/{id}, PUT /tasks/{id}, DELETE /tasks/{id} are functional.
API supports filtering tasks by category and due date.
API includes authentication and authorization checks.

engineeringTasks.title: Implement Offline Data Storage with Service Worker
engineeringTasks.description: Set up IndexedDB for local task storage and configure a Service Worker to intercept network requests and serve cached data/sync offline changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks can be created/modified in IndexedDB when offline.
Application loads and displays tasks from IndexedDB when offline.
Service Worker successfully caches application assets for offline access.

engineeringTasks.title: Develop Task List UI and Filtering
engineeringTasks.description: Build the frontend component to display a list of tasks, including options to filter by category, sort by due date, and mark tasks as complete.
acceptanceCriteria: Task list displays all active tasks.
Filter options for categories and due dates are present and functional.
Tasks can be marked as complete with visual feedback.
Responsive design principles applied for mobile view.

engineeringTasks.title: Implement Data Synchronization Logic
engineeringTasks.description: Develop the client-side and server-side logic to synchronize offline changes with the backend, handling potential conflicts (e.g., last-write-wins).
acceptanceCriteria: Offline changes are pushed to the server upon reconnection.
Server-side updates are pulled to the client.
Conflict resolution strategy (e.g., last-write-wins) is implemented and tested.
Synchronization occurs automatically in the background.

engineeringTasks.title: End-to-End Testing for Offline Sync Flow
engineeringTasks.description: Write and execute automated end-to-end tests to verify the complete offline task creation/modification and subsequent synchronization process.
acceptanceCriteria: Test cases cover creating a task offline and verifying sync.
Test cases cover modifying a task offline and verifying sync.
Test cases cover deleting a task offline and verifying sync.
Tests pass consistently across different network conditions (simulated).

engineeringTasks.title: Set up CI/CD Pipeline for Web App Deployment
engineeringTasks.description: Configure a CI/CD pipeline to automate building, testing, and deploying the web application to a hosting environment.
acceptanceCriteria: Automated build process triggered on code commit.
Automated unit and integration tests run as part of the pipeline.
Successful deployment to staging environment upon passing tests.
Manual approval step for production deployment.

risks.title: Complex Offline Data Synchronization
risks.description: Implementing robust offline data storage and seamless synchronization across multiple devices, especially handling data conflicts and ensuring data integrity, can be technically challenging and prone to subtle bugs.
risks.mitigation: Research and select a proven offline-first framework/library (e.g., PouchDB/CouchDB, Realm Sync) to leverage existing solutions. Prioritize a simpler conflict resolution strategy initially (e.g., last-write-wins) and iterate. Conduct extensive testing under various network conditions.

risks.title: Performance Degradation on Mobile Devices
risks.description: The application might perform poorly on older mobile devices or with very slow internet connections, especially due to the overhead of offline storage and synchronization, leading to a frustrating user experience.
risks.mitigation: Implement aggressive caching strategies for assets and data. Optimize frontend rendering performance. Conduct thorough performance testing on a range of devices and network speeds. Prioritize critical paths for optimization.

risks.title: Security of Locally Stored Data
risks.description: Sensitive user task data stored offline on devices (e.g., in IndexedDB) could be vulnerable if the device is compromised, potentially exposing personal information.
risks.mitigation: Encrypt local data storage where feasible. Implement secure authentication and authorization for data access. Educate users on device security best practices. Avoid storing highly sensitive data offline if not absolutely necessary.
